literals: "Adds ssh hosts to the ssh config file. Is kind of a simple script which doesn't support all the options. May update with more stuff. \nExample usage: ./ssh_adder myhost 192.168.80.1 --user someuser --port 2200 --conf /path/to/non-default/ssh/config"
"This is the name of the Host to add to the config. For instance, if you want to do `ssh somehost`, then name should be `somehost`"
"This is the hostname/ip address of the host. If `somehost`'s address is 192.168.80.1, then hostname=192.168.80.1"
"The user to connect with. Defaults to root"
"The port to connect to. Defaults to 22"
"The path to the ssh config file. Defaults to ~/.ssh/config, which is the default location. "
comments: create the parser for the "a" command
